baselines.notes: Starter subset — AC and IR families only. Replace with full baseline for production use.

baselines.description: Moderate-impact information systems per FIPS 199. Covers ~80% of federal cloud authorizations.
baselines.notes: Starter subset — AC and IR families only. FedRAMP Moderate adds parameter assignments and enhancements beyond NIST SP 800-53 Moderate baseline.

baselines.description: High-impact information systems per FIPS 199. Required for systems processing classified or national security data.
baselines.notes: Starter subset — AC and IR families only. FedRAMP High aligns with DoD IL5/IL6 when combined with DISA SRG overlays.

IL2.description: Public and non-CUI data on commercial cloud

IL4.additional_controls: DISA Cloud Computing SRG IL4 overlay

IL5.description: CUI and mission-critical data requiring higher protection
IL5.additional_controls: DISA Cloud Computing SRG IL5 overlay, NIST 800-171 CUI requirements

IL6.additional_controls: CNSSI 1253, ICD 503, DISA Cloud Computing SRG IL6 overlay, classified system authorization

fips_199_methodology.description: FIPS 199 categorization uses the high-water mark approach: the overall system impact level equals the highest impact level among confidentiality, integrity, and availability.
fips_199_methodology.example: A system with Moderate confidentiality, Low integrity, and Low availability has an overall categorization of Moderate.
